messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/MediaController.php`, I found that `App\\Http\\Controllers\\Api\\V1\\MediaController@store` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
- Full path:
  /v1/media

- All HTTP methods acceptable:
  false

- HEAD:
  false

- POST:
  true

- OPTIONS:
  false

- TRACE:
  false

- GET:
  true

- PUT:
  false

- DELETE:
  false

- PATCH:
  false

Explanation
- In routes/api.php there are two resource route registrations for "media":
  - Inside the auth/verified middleware group: Route::apiResource('media', MediaController::class)->only(['store', 'destroy']); — this creates a POST route for storing (POST /v1/media) and a DELETE route for destroying (DELETE /v1/media/{media}) under the v1 prefix.
  - Outside the middleware group: Route::apiResource('media', MediaController::class)->only('index'); — this creates the GET route for listing (GET /v1/media) under the same v1 prefix.

- Therefore the store action in App\Http\Controllers\Api\V1\MediaController@store is served at /v1/media and the same path also has a GET route (index). Based strictly on the route definitions in the code, only GET and POST are defined for /v1/media; no explicit routes for HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, PUT, DELETE (for this exact path), or PATCH are defined in the code. "All methods" is not enabled anywhere in the provided routing code, so that is false.

- Note: the POST /v1/media route is defined inside a middleware group (auth:sanctum, verified) as shown in the file; the GET /v1/media (index) route is defined outside that middleware group. The above method availability is determined from the route definitions in code only.
